name.text: 27.2.1.3 Functions as Limits of Integration Task

questiontext.text:
Integrate the function \(z = x^2 y\) over the trapezium with vertices at \((0,0)\), \(({@bb@},1)\), \(({@bb@},{@cc@})\) and \((0,{@aa@})\).

\(I=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
The integration takes place over the trapezium shown below

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { // STACK: when moving to STACK change 'jxgboard' for divid boundingbox: [-0.25, {#aa +1#}, {#bb+0.5#}, -1], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, grid: false }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on x-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.x.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, // hide numbers majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'x', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [8, -10] } }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on y-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.y.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'y', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [-15, 0] } }); // points var bl = board.create('point', [0,0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var br = board.create('point', [{#bb#},1], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var tr = board.create('point', [{#bb#},{#cc#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var tl = board.create('point', [0,{#aa#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var trapezium = board.create('polygon', [bl, br, tr, tl],{name:"Trapezium",withLabel:false, color: 'white'}); // Set all edges (borders) to black trapezium.borders.forEach(line => { line.setAttribute({strokeColor: 'black'}); }); // Label coordinates dynamically [bl, br, tr, tl].forEach((pt) => { board.create('text', [ () => pt.X() + 0.1, () => pt.Y() + 0.1, () => `(${pt.X()}, ${pt.Y()})` ], { fontSize: 12, fixed: true, highlight: false }); }); [[/jsxgraph]]

Considering variable \(x\) on the outer integral and variable \(y\) on the inner integral, the trapezium has an extent in \(x\) of \(x=0\) to \(x={@bb@}\). So, the limits on the outer integral (limits on \(x\)) are \(x=0\) and \(x={@bb@}\).

For each value of \(x\), \(y\) varies from \(y = \dfrac{x}{@bb@}\) (line joining \((0,0)\)to \(({@bb@},1)\)) to \(y = {@dd*x + aa@}\) (line joining \(({@bb@},{@cc@})\) and \((0,{@aa@})\)). So the limits on the inner integral (limits on \(y\)) are \(y = \dfrac{x}{@bb@}\) to \(y = {@dd*x + aa@}\).

The double integral thus becomes

\(\qquad \displaystyle\int_{x=0}^{@bb@} \int_{y={@x/bb@}}^{@dd*x + aa@} x^2 y \, \mathrm{d}y \, \mathrm{d}x\)

The inner integral is

\[\begin{align} \text{Inner}\hspace{0.1cm} \text{Integral} = \int_{@x/bb@}^{@dd*x + aa@} x^2 y \, \mathrm{d}y = \left[ x^2 \frac{y^2}{2} \right]_{@x/bb@}^{@dd*x + aa@} &= x^2 \frac{({@dd*x+aa@})^2}{2} - x^2 \frac{({@x/bb@})^2}{2} \\ &= {@dd^2*x^4/2 + 2*aa*dd*x^3/2 + aa^2*x^2/2 - x^4/2*bb^2@} \end{align}\]

Putting this into the outer integral gives

\[\begin{align} \text{Outer}\hspace{0.1cm} \text{Integral} = \int_{x=0}^{@bb@} \left({@dd^2*x^4/2 + 2*aa*dd*x^3/2 + aa^2*x^2/2 - x^4/2*bb^2@}\right)\, \mathrm{d}x &= \left[{@(dd^2/10)*x^5 + (aa*dd/4)*x^4 + (aa^2/6)*x^3 - (1/10*bb^2)*x^5@} \right]_0^{@bb@} \\ &= \left({@(dd^2/10) - (1/10*bb^2)@}\times({@bb@})^5 {@(aa*dd/4)@}\times ({@bb@})^4 + {@(aa^2/6)@}\times({@bb@})^3 \right) - 0 \\ &= {@ta1@}. \end{align}\]
